snippet: Rachel Noerdlinger is at the center of a controversy that has rattled City Hall and raised concerns about the vetting of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s most senior aides.
abstract: Rachel Noerdlinger, chief of staff to New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's wife, Chirlane McCray, is at center of controversy that has rattled City Hall; city investigators question her after learning that she had failed to disclose on a background questionnaire that she lived with a boyfriend, Hassaun McFarlan, who had extensive criminal record; false or misleading statements on such a form can result in termination or prosecution.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM, NIKITA STEWART and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

lead_paragraph: Rachel Noerdlinger is at the center of a controversy that has rattled City Hall and raised concerns about the vetting of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s most senior aides.

headline.main: At City Hall, Backstage Player Is Cast in Main Stage Uproar
headline.print_headline: At City Hall, Backstage Player Is Cast in Main Stage Uproar
